title: [K-12] Augmented Reality-Based UDL Learning Design for Integrated Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (coordinate systems, spatial perception)
context.additional_context: Inclusive educational environment for students with and without disabilities, utilizing digital devices (tablets/smartphones)

learning_goals: Learners can explain geometric transformations (translation, rotation, scaling) in a 3D coordinate system using augmented reality tools with 80% accuracy
Learners achieve over 70% collaboration with peer learners in mathematical problem-solving processes using digital learning materials based on UDL principles
Over 85% of learners demonstrate creative solutions utilizing spatial reasoning skills in augmented reality assignments submitted on the LMS platform
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
